index.week_label: February 20, 2026 Input Columns, Blobby Learns to Validate Work, AI Quickstarts, and More
index.title: February 20, 2026 Input Columns, Blobby Learns to Validate Work, AI Quickstarts, and More

weeks_detail.title: Demos
summary_bullets: Our more advanced modelers have been using Claude Code to unlock huge productivity in the CLI for modeling workflows. We wanted to make sure everyone has access to AI tools when building data models. Now Blobby will follow you around the IDE and can intervene to build model (in branches of course). Goal is extreme productivity and way less busywork (think formats on 100s of fields, automating descriptions, or even heavier SQL building - anything you can imagine). As always, this isn't a black box, and developers can review before accepting to make sure everything works as expected.

We have lots of folks integrating Blobby into external MCP use cases. It means you can bring all of the Omni goodness to any AI workflow you can imagine. We also wanted to make it easier for folks to get going. Now you can use Omni as the central MCP - calling independent services alongside Blobby where we'll manage the connectivity. This will open up Salesforce updates, Notion, even custom internal tools inside Blobby. Very excited to see what folks do with this.

We introduced a brand new toggle to unleash Blobby on the less-modeled All Views and Fields. This won't be for everyone, but opens up completely new, less-modeled use cases for more productivity with AI. Plan to open up SQL in the future as well to make sure we offer the full spectrum of experience.

Now you can flag explicit documents for Blobby to look-up when answering tactical questions (think product roadmap, pricing, or other internal knowledge base docs you may want AI to reference and/or query).
Some small UX improvements to make sure the Slack responses from Blobby look great and are easy to read.

Another small AI tune-up. We have some current limits on file size with Blobby (very much plan to relax these and allow bigger and bigger files). Either way, wanted to make sure it was clear what we can support in terms of external files in the UI.

We've completely overhauled the dashboard search experience - now you can search for others' favorites, by tag, or other facets to quickly find what you need. Let us know what else you wish was available in the search index.
We're working on some new UX to show the difference between centralized model objects and workbook-only objects. More to do here but want to make sure governance and ownership is always clear.
Now Omni makes sure your downloads into Excel can preserve value formatting, etc when grabbing XLSX files.
Soon you'll be able to define visualizations alongside the explicit drill fields or drill queries for richer workflows.
Another look into how we're building internal tools and processes to make sure we can ship better, faster.

weeks_detail.title: Demos
summary_bullets: Blobby didn't want Claude to have all the fun. Soon we'll open up different LLM providers ChatGPT, Gemini, BYO. Will make sure there are admin controls here of course for folks that want it.
Blobby has all sorts of skills - agentic querying, visualization, summarization, field building, calculation. We wanted to provide power users a way to direct to these different tools explicitly.
We tuned up with streaming chat experience to hide the less important while still showing the full train of thought when you need it.
A quick DIY project to open up voice with Blobby. Early days, but helps open up the imagination for what's possible.
Bringing the front-end totals experience to SQL queries (think simple sum, count, average, etc down a column)
It's now a couple click to build duration fields in the UI (of course with model pushdown when needed).

Now full range calculations - think SUM(B:B), AVERAGE(C:C), etc - can be pushed down using LOD fields. This makes comparison fields trivial to build in the UI but manage like robust data model when you need it.
Some new toggles with Top N to ignore / include filters for comparison to the population at large or not.
Now you can quickly toggle between the specific fields in use or the views in use - most helpful in gigantic topics or all views and fields.
We made it simple to organize workbook tabs by type, name, etc (tell us anything else you want to see here).
A nice end-to-end demo of the new tabs (pages) experience for dashboards. Beta out now, let us know if you want activated.

A first look at playing around with cross-filterable dashboards. We have some UX to consider around native filters vs cross-filters and what we want to allow. Would love feedback on whether these should be 'different' vs dovetailing into the native filter experience.
Sometimes you just want to map a filter to 40 tiles at once. We're leaving in the in-line UX but now offering a bulk mapping experience alongside.
Some new designs were building towards for complex multi-tab dashboards.
We built a front-end UX around organizing topics into groups with auto-complete, etc for a nicer experience.
Now you can query Snowflake semantic views directly in Omni. This means we now have translators back and forth for more native experience, but also have rounded out querying them directly too.
For the Blobby lovers out there, now you can build your own avatar using our custom Blobby builder.
Continue to build out more native vis. Here we have an early look at Sankey charts.
Now the queries page will live update so you can actively track and manage database usage from Omni (for one minute - we don't want these pages polling forever).
The dbt integration is now up and running in Azure as well - more progress getting the full app available in Azure.
We're making the heuristics for choosing the right aggregate better to make sure queries get faster for end users.
Plus we're continuing to tune up the new docs experience

weeks_detail.title: Demos
summary_bullets: Getting close to launching the new pie - now with percentage calculations, optional totals, and much better labeling.
Now you can select some or all of the running queries in Omni for fast cancelation.
More progress on lifting the full app into Azure. Here we demo the scheduler experience.
You could already mask fields via custom SQL but we're building some native gestures to make it easier to build and manage.
Now you can push your Omni model backwards into Snowflake Semantic Views for usage completely outside the Omni platform.

A pair of demos. First a quick warning when you try to save un-run SQL to make sure it's not dropped from that pending state. The second is a tweak to allow sharing dashboards quickly with a comma delimited list for faster bulk workflows.
A quick tweak to make sure long lists of tags still look great.
A quick internal demo for finding and managing feature flags.
We're completely rebuilding the drag and layout controls for dashboards to make it way better to work with. Here's an early look at all that work and what it unlocks for dashboard builders.
The dashboard now supports % zoom for earlier layout control, resizing, and for view context more easily when using AI or building filters.

A four pack of UX improvements - making sure measure groups unfurl on search; better SQL auto-complete; code folding in the IDE; and better behavior on formatting / unformatting in the markdown editor.
Soon you'll have complete control over filter positions and sizing - this opens up a bunch of new, functional UX for dashboard builders.
No more dead dashboard pages, now users can explicit request access (with associated email) and documents have a pending requests page for management.
We launched a handful of new APIs for kicking off and polling downloads for all the app builders out there.
We tuned up the experience for branch-attached-drafts
We wanted to spice up the app a bit, so bringing custom Blobbys to the core app. This also starts putting in the groundwork for BYO emojis natively in Omni.
A nice UX improvement to allow dragging dashboards into folders in the content system.
A quick new visualization for tabular bar charts with detail.
Now you can create complex filters that span across multi-fields. Also opens up these use cases nicely for AI + tuning.
We all know LLMs can be prone to vibe-math (ahem, r's in strawberry). So we're building new tools to make sure when Blobby is doing math, it has the tools it needs to be precise.
A first look at some future work to allow undo / redo on dashboard layout.
A first look at the beautiful new tab designer experience. We don't just want to land tabs, we want to make them designable and pretty.

videos.description: Soon you'll have complete control over filter positions and sizing - this opens up a bunch of new, functional UX for dashboard builders.
videos.author: James Bueche

videos.title: Drag to Organize Dashboards
videos.description: A nice UX improvement to allow dragging dashboards into folders in the content system.
videos.author: Mariel Freyre

videos.title: UX Polish Grab Bag
videos.description: A four pack of UX improvements - making sure measure groups unfurl on search; better SQL auto-complete; code folding in the IDE; and better behavior on formatting / unformatting in the markdown editor.
videos.author: Jared Hardy

videos.title: New Download APIs
videos.description: We launched a handful of new APIs for kicking off and polling downloads for all the app builders out there.
videos.author: Corey Ruderman

videos.title: Custom Emojis
videos.description: We wanted to spice up the app a bit, so bringing custom Blobbys to the core app. This also starts putting in the groundwork for BYO emojis natively in Omni.
videos.author: Luke Bowerman

videos.title: Styled Bar Chart Table
videos.description: A quick new visualization for tabular bar charts with detail.
videos.author: Sarah Waterson

videos.title: Compound / Complex Filters
videos.description: Now you can create complex filters that span across multi-fields. Also opens up these use cases nicely for AI + tuning.
videos.author: Steven Talbot

videos.title: Teaching Blobby To Do Better Math
videos.description: We all know LLMs can be prone to vibe-math (ahem, r's in strawberry). So we're building new tools to make sure when Blobby is doing math, it has the tools it needs to be precise.
videos.author: Steven Talbot

weeks_detail.title: Demos
summary_bullets: Our second most requested feature is done. Now that we've landed a bunch of the vis rework for stacked and grouped bars, we've opened up dynamic stack ordering for stacked charts.
We're getting ready to open up deep research for everyone. This enables Blobby to build and check off multi-stage plans for deeper analysis on the same governed foundation.

Omni has always had the ability to build fields for re-use everywhere, or only inside a single-topic. Now we've wired that up to the UI for way better curation of complex data models. This also lays the ground work for moving fields from views into topics and back from topics into views. Making sure we have the best tools in the world for managing semantics.

We're getting close to release for a new experience meant to better handle massive schemas. Better search, handling for offloaded schemas (TLDR faster search because less metadata), and some UX tune-ups.
We improved color opacity and layering for maps to make sure they maintain readability while still looking great.

Little bit of tune up to our work last week to improve conditional formatting readability. This takes it the last mile with text color intelligence across light and dark mode (after some customer feedback, thank you).
We did a bunch of work in the background to make pivots over large data sets with fill much much faster.
We're bulking up the scheduler to allow for significantly more scale in sharing reporting dynamically across many users in one shot (bursting).
We made content permissions more clear when permissions are being inherited from parent folders.
We made dragging fields into the SQL editor way easier

weeks_detail.title: Demos
summary_bullets: We're building another AI layer in Omni for summarizing and analyzing the results of many queries on a dashboard. Just another way to make the query results more consumable for your end users. Continuing the work to give you every control for creating amazing experiences on polished dashboards - now you can insert custom empty messages or error messages.
Our dashboards are now available in more languages. We're beginning to role out Omni for embedded use cases in other languages. Plus some discussion of follow-on work around localization.
Another demo of the significant overhaul to dashboard construction, including some nice quality of life work around managing and deleting tiles.
Now you can map dashboard filters to calculations as well as dimensions and measures.
We're still working on enabling instant slice and dice for dashboard. Here we demo a dashboard fully served out of the cubing layer.
Quick fix to more elegantly handle dashboard AI summaries when the feature gets flipped off.
We're getting close on new custom permissions. A demo of how we handle duplication and resolution between different permission groupings.

We're tried to torture Vega into allowing for great pie charts, unfortunately we haven't found a clear path. So we're testing eCharts for pies to open up much better user experiences. We'll explore this system for a variety of charts that can complement the Vega Lite core.

A trio of demos here: 1. turning off right click actions for embed. Just another way to tune the experience and deliver exactly what you want 2. better URL encoding for markdown values (now you can request the URL encoded markdown) and 3. multi-line selection and formatting in markdown
Early work as some new UI for preparing and sharing golden AI queries

weeks_detail.title: Demos
summary_bullets: Blobby is getting smarter again. Now you can build fields directly from the AI query (of course inside the permission envelope of the core app). This means on-the-fly aggregates, derivative dimensions, etc are as easy as telling the AI what you want.

We're bringing Blobby wherever you want to take him. Here's a quick demo of Omni in Goose (https://github.com/block/goose) alongside generic AI functions. Now data is accessible from whatever chat services make sense in your org.

We're beefing up the querying engine to open up level of detail calculations in Omni. Escape or force grouping independent of the rest of the query. Great for dynamic percent of totals, comparison to unfiltered data, or other complex calculations. Let us know what you want to see here.
Now Blobby will tell you what it's doing while it does it, improving performance and the general experience.
We tuned up the dashboard layout experience to make sizing tiles more delightful.
We added some new config to force exposing long filter lists beyond the default single line.
Sometimes data isn't quite at the right grain for a great visualization, so we added tooling to aggregate directly from the visualization.
We've improved the front-end for the long tail of color mapping over huge lists.
A nice mini app to show custom per-use navigation for an embedded experience.
Now all the data modeling you do in Omni can also be lifted to the new Snowflake Semantic layer for use in Cortex AI.
We tuned up the group page to improve performing by 100x on long user lists.

weeks_detail.title: Demos
summary_bullets: Now that AI can do some incredible things, it makes sense to put Blobby in more places. Here's an early cut of the Slack experience.

Lots more work on AI - putting the finishing touches on launching AI mode to everyone (now with nice linking to workbook pages). Plus making it simple to train inside a topic with example queries and nice suggestions for descriptive text to improve recall.
Showing off how nice the embed navigation can experience for more custom use cases plus some discussion of custom filters outside the iframe.
More work on user-specific models, showing how this will work to localize data models. This will have many applications for more complex permissions and layering of models.
We're still working on exposing as much of the internal API as possible. More demos of branch management and modeling.
When unnesting data, you may need more complex tooling to ensure correct aggregation. This is that complex tooling.
As Snowflake encourages movement to key-pair auth for db connections, we're making sure folks have the tools they need.
Another great vibe code example of what you can build on top of the API. This allows for visualizing Omni data across 12 different visualization libraries.

And more custom vis:

A new cut on subtotal visualization for a bit more visual polish.

Another custom vis for the library, the spider / radar chart.

We made a fun visualization showing business growth alongside the team. A great example of the interactive vis you can build.
A new cut on subtotal visualization for a bit more visual polish.
Another custom vis for the library, the spider / radar chart.
We made a fun visualization showing business growth alongside the team. A great example of the interactive vis you can build.

weeks_detail.title: Demos
summary_bullets: A first look at the new UX for creating data from the workbook or dashboard. Now you can build columns that allow collecting data from end users. Opens up tons of read/write use cases for specific workflows.

Blobby is great, but doesn't always get it right on the first try. We're building more intelligence into the AI experience by explicitly validating the results matched the user's intent correctly. More work to do here, but want to make sure Blobby can always get it right hands off.

The biggest blocker to more Blobby is often getting started. Here we show off building a data model and AI context from scratch entirely in the UI. More work to do here, but want to make getting started with a new data set or table completely AI-able.
Workflows have been in GA for a bit, but we wanted to show off some internal use cases that are creating huge efficiencies for us. We'll get these in the docs for folks that want to crib or extend.
More Blobby MCP - this time bringing Google calendar into the AI experience.

With the near term GA of containers (the new dashboard experience), we wanted to make it easy to build beautiful dashboards even with the additional belles and whistles. Templates make common dashboard patterns easier to build and control.
More refinement to the color picker experience.
The new funnel vis is moving to GA.
We love to see a first-week demo. Here picking up a much-requested feature for configuring pie chart labels more flexibly (like percentages alongside values).
More complex embed setups often have customers with different fiscal calendars and business weeks. Now you can serve that complexity dynamically using user attributes.
Bunch of tune up for the IDE experience - improved file search UX and some tune up to the sidebar search as well.
An end-to-end demo of building data model + AI context via Cursor and Omni CLI. This means folks can bring help docs from external sources like Notion to instant build context into Omni.

Another internal productivity workflow we wanted to share. This allows us to take Slack threads with feedback or bug reports and instantly file rich Github tickets (ideally to mostly-automate resolution via Claude Code).

videos.title: Blobby Learns to Analyze Hand Drawn Notes
videos.description: All I can say is you need to watch this one if you want to see the future. We have some of the basics with a new twist, like conversations and tagging for dashboards. But we also layer in hand-drawn annotation (think Microsoft paint) combined with the magic of Blobby. Circle an outlier and ask Blobby to go figure out why. Drill with a marker. Ask a question with a picture. This is a window into the future of analytics.
videos.author: Chris Swenson
videos.tag: The Future, Ai, Dashboards, Workbook, I Cant Describe This Properly Just Watch

videos.title: Python in Omni Plus Blobby Learns Python
videos.description: The goal with Omni has always been more of everything. Python is more of something. Here we give a demo of some work on bringing data science to the app, and, of course, making sure Blobby can take advantage.
videos.author: Gustav Staprans

videos.title: Model Demotion
videos.description: The monotonic model growth will be no more! Maybe the feature request we've talked about the most internally. Data models grow. Sometimes that is good, sometimes it was because you did a one-off thing you're never going to look at again (or maybe even look at, but don't need polluting everyone's headspace). Conrad worked on bringing all that metadata to the data model, and ultimately allow users to push data model from the shared model back into their dashboards!!
videos.author: Conrad Slimmer

videos.title: Super Serious[ly Awesome] Emoji AI Feedback
videos.description: Feedback (and the follow up tuning) is a core part of building the AI experience. This demo reimagines the AI feedback with emojis to quickly let your developers know what is working and what isn't. And some fun baked in too.
videos.author: Mariel Freyre

videos.title: Crossfiltering Beta
videos.description: Coming soon! We've been putting work into the cross-filter UX so you can slice and dice to hearts content with charts instead of filters. Testing internally, let us know if you want an early look.
videos.author: Steven Talbot

videos.title: Blobby Learns to Spreadsheet
videos.description: Step one was bringing a full dashboard into Omni. Step two is making it so AI can build those spreadsheets for you. Richard demos a few of those functions, including an instant invoice generation from a row of data, styling, or quick summary stats.
videos.author: Richard Czechowski

videos.title: Blobby Learns to Build Dashboards
videos.description: Alisa shows off a quick tool to let Blobby bring content between environments (plus an awesome loader). Stay until the end to see Blobby building a new dashboard tile on the fly. More AI everywhere.
videos.author: Alisa Tatarinova

videos.title: Omni Full App Inside MCP
videos.description: Bit of a futuristic demo. Here we load the full app into the MCP experience, including backlinks to the core app.
videos.author: Meredith Dodge

videos.title: Blobby Learns to Build a DB Connection
videos.description: AI everywhere is the goal. Blobby takes on adding a new database connection in Omni, meaning you can set up a connection and get querying inside a minute in the AI chat.
videos.author: Nate Agrin

videos.title: Connection Setup Clean Up
videos.description: Bunch of fresh UX paint on the connection setup page. Better organization, more clear feedback, instant model, etc.
videos.author: Nate Agrin

videos.title: Blobby Learns to Debug Your Database Connection
videos.description: A little AI makes everything better. Here Blobby helps figure out why the DB connection didn't go as plans, with little helpers and a Q&A to get you unblocked quickly.
videos.author: Cathy Lennon

videos.title: Embed Web Components
videos.description: Adding a bit more delight to the developer experience for embed builders.
videos.author: Nate Agrin

videos.title: Omni CLI + Omni 1980 UI
videos.description: Bunch of work on the CLI, including a nice new (?) UX.
videos.author: Nate Agrin

videos.title: Release FYI / Understand Omni Versions
videos.description: We ship alot of code (34 demos this week). It makes debugging which app version is live tricky for us internally. Our friendly neighborhood devops team built a full UI + Slack experience to make sure we can debug quickly.
videos.author: Brian Frantz

videos.title: Dashboard Auto Pretty Plus New Layout Controls
videos.description: First, we show off some new UX controls for dashboards - multi-element grabbing, keyboard controls, quick delete, etc. Then you see some new AI magic for instantly making a dashboard layout nicely. More to do here, but AI everywhere!
videos.author: James Bueche

videos.title: Omni Employee Directory
videos.description: Sam had some fun creating a new internal tool to find Omnis.
videos.author: Sam Pittman

videos.title: Blobby Learns to Surf the Web
videos.description: Blobby can soon enrich results with live web queries, for deeper, multi-modal use cases (all fake names, etc).
videos.author: Jamie Davidson

videos.title: Long Running Task Notifications
videos.description: It's not fun to sit and stare at your monitor for long-running tasks (think queries then render or long AI sessions). Soon you'll be able to use notifications to return when the job is done.
videos.author: Trip Tate

videos.title: letmeblobbythatforyou.com
videos.description: We built a quick microsite for when you need to help a friend understand their data better.
videos.author: Chris Merrick

videos.title: Blobby Suggests Dashboards Instead
videos.description: Blobby has been a magical unlock for avoiding dashboard bloat. Just ask. But sometimes there was already a dashboard that answers your question perfectly. Soon Blobby can redirect you to those instead of reinventing the wheel.
videos.author: Chris Merrick

videos.title: AI Explo-to-Omni Conversion Tooling
videos.description: The former Explo team shows off a bunch of new tooling to bring dashboards and reports from Explo instantly into Omni, of course with lots of Clauding behind the scenes.
videos.author: Gary Lin

videos.title: Blobby Tasks
videos.description: Surely you've done an analysis that you had to present in slides. Soon Blobby can build your decks or docs for you. Arielle shows off a few use cases for the new AI Tasks.
videos.author: Arielle Strong

videos.title: Blobby Learns ETL
videos.description: If you're anything like us, on the last day of the quarter you're sitting on dashboards waiting for the new ETL to land. Soon Blobby will be able to reach into Fivetran for new data on command.
videos.author: Chris Merrick

videos.title: Automated Documentation
videos.description: We ship alot of code. Sometime docs are the bottleneck for customers taking advantage (including screenshots). The team has been working on offloading some of that work to Claude to make sure our docs can keep up with our builders.
videos.author: Nancy Chacko

videos.title: Table Text Formatting
videos.description: We're prettying up the data table with pills and icons (backed with conditional formatting of course), so your data pops. And, like everything else, can take advantage of modeled colors for consistent table presentations anywhere you use dimensions.
videos.author: Sarah Waterson

videos.title: Markdown Columns
videos.description: We're bringing all the flexibility of markdown to the data table. Grab values across the row for quick ultra-flexible data styling.
videos.author: Richard Czechowski

videos.title: AI Columns Any Dialect
videos.description: We already released AI functions in Snowflake, but soon you'll be able to take advantage of classifiers and other quick row-actions in any dialect using our calc layer.
videos.author: Richard Czechowski

videos.title: Blobby Learns to Slack
videos.description: The goal is buttons only when you want them. Here we quickly send a dashboard to Slack using Blobby.
videos.author: Eli Cohen

videos.title: Multi-Step MCP Omni Workflows
videos.description: An end-to-end demo of Blobby writing query, building dashboard with said query, and even building up a schedule on the result. Running the whole app from the MCP chat box.
videos.author: Corey Ruderman

videos.title: Blobby Voice Mode
videos.description: We're seeing more and more Blobby usage on mobile, so Jared built a way to take advantage of voice for AI data exploration.
videos.author: Jared Hardy

videos.title: Dark Mode Vis Config Defaults
videos.description: An early preview of enabling chart styles independently for dark mode.
videos.author: Jared Hardy

videos.title: Styling Stub Periods in Charts
videos.description: Is there anything worse than a time-series chart that tanks on the last data point because of a partial time period? Probably. But we fixed that anyways. Soon you can style your chart stubs to make sure your conclusions are that much more obvious.
videos.author: Mike Torosian

videos.title: Autohealing Code Tests
videos.description: Our dev team got some new goodies too. Here we show off an end-to-end framework for Claude to understand and refine tests that let us ship safer, better, faster.
videos.author: Kalen Petersen

videos.title: Release Summarization AI
videos.description: Bit of new tooling to make sure the product team can see everything getting shipped and make sure you all know about it.
videos.author: Jack Sweeney

weeks_detail.title: Demos
summary_bullets: Blobby isn't only for querying. Now you can get some help building out your dashboards courtesy of a Blobby helper for building and arranging dashboards. Early days here, but would love thoughts on where this can help builders get more productive.
We made some huge improvements to the UX and clarity of the AI streaming experience to make sure it both feels amazing and clearly shows you what it's working on.
Now when you use Blobby inside Claude MCP, we can make sure authentication and the UX is personalized to each user. This also opens up the Claude marketplace for Omni and Blobby.

Blobby is bringing the full suite of capabilities to the API. Now your API queries can progress through the same logical, multi-query experience as the UI. This will power the incoming Slackbot, or really whatever you can imagine.

AI summary visualizations are fabulous - summarize and synthesize for the user. But sometimes you want to be able to dig in to the actuals too. Soon you'll be able to toggle between the results and the AI summarization (or visualizations).
Now instead of your favorite foundation LLM, you can also swap in Snowflake Cortex.
More work on brand new visualizations. This time a look at our work on funnels. Tell us what you want to see in here (and next).
Blobby wanted to get in on the vis game. A first look at fill charts Omni style.
A grab bag of UI/UX improvements to our new dashboards. Keep the feedback coming, we're continuing to make sure the new experience is great.
Making sure dragging tiles around (including in and out of containers) feels great.
After some feedback about making auto-complete and the content validator experience better, we spent a bit of time making sure clean up and admin feels great too.
Soon you'll be able to see workbook model changes in a couple clicks.
Some new modeling work to enable filter push down into joined views, plus a bunch of testing framework on our side to understanding ongoing model improvement work.
Much more flexibility for folks embedding side-by-side or swapping experiences for users - now you can have one user logged in to different experiences without full re-authentication.
Bunch of work to enable great git work flows in the most complex deployments (like extension models), plus some conversation on future there.
Some mostly silent work to make long running queries work better, especially with weak internet.
Bit of work on our admin and setup.
Another peek into work on our internal tooling to ship more, better, faster.

weeks_detail.title: Demos
summary_bullets: Now you get the full copy experience from our native data tables - highlight and copy cells trivially out of the front-end, including keyboard controls.
A first look at completely customizing the filter UX for dashboards - think buttons, selector lists, whatever you can imagine. Let us know what you'd like to see here.
You could already permalink your dashboards with vanity URLs, now you can do the same with your tabs to make navigation feel amazing for your users.
Not quite a demo, but soon Blobby will be on call for helping modelers in the IDE.

Frequently your friendly neighborhood blob will need to run multiple queries to answer a question. Now Blobby can selectively parallelize querying to speed up the AI experience by orders of magnitude. More work to do here, but the side-by-side shows how massive the diff can be.
Now when you select you favorite colors for charting or conditional formatting we'll remember and let you quickly reuse them elsewhere.
Now you can copy conditional formatting rules in a click for easy table building.
A grab bag of UX improvements for layout on containers.
A quick refinement for our new request-access workflow. Now for documents you don't want folks asking about, you can opt for a 404 page rather than the request workflow in document settings.

Now when you try to share a dashboard we'll flag app permissions that mean a user cannot view the object (say no permissions to the data set requested). This makes it more clear if you need to use accessboost or talk to an admin about opening up data to others.
Making it simpler to authenticate for Safari users.
Weeks were stubbornly avoiding the DuckDB requery cache for certain use cases that now work nicely.
Bunch of hidden work to improve downloads with totals.
We're going deep on building out the modeling experience for model extensions (think personal, departmental mini data models) and branches.
A couple tune ups - first a quick link to the SQL from the dashboard (we may limit to developers), and a fix up to groups to make sure we don't error with emojis, et al.
We tuned up the auto-complete and input experience for the embed URL builder to make getting started easier.

And more behind the scenes on how we build:

Bit of our internal workflow for documenting code and making our team more productive using Claude Code.

Another bundle of work to improve our internal developer productivity.

weeks_detail.title: Demos
summary_bullets: We're making it easier to get to Blobby, plus some admin controls for folks who aren't quite ready.
We tuned up the summary experience to even share grouplets of visualizations alongside summary text.
More work on our Model Inspector tool for understanding the data model inside the AI experience. Plus a bonus internal demo of continuing to build out our Claude Code workflows.
We improved the UX to make tool calls (filter value checks, model calls, etc) more explicit in the UI, so users can understand everything Blobby is doing at query time.
Now the MCP server can intelligently route queries between different models rather than locking to a single model.
Bit of work to see more detail on how fields are used in the AI experience from the chat UI.
Sankey charts are launching, now with color controls as well. Plus stick around to the end for a preview of the next set of vis work.
Building on our request access workflows - now viewers can request edit access for dashboard they want to tune as well.
A new multi-base-view topic in Omni. TJ gives a quick explainer of multi-fact entities and how you can now model them in Omni.
Now you can quickly point filter-only fields at the view itself for dynamically filtering a view with minimal modeling.
The Oracle database connector is now in preview for folks.
Now you can page through infinite results inside the subtotal UX.
We added some explicit position debugging UX with XY coordinates for precision tuning your dashboards.
Progress continues on new dashboards - now with more controls for layout and padding.
Inside workbooks you can now quickly see topics in use across your other tabs for faster navigation.
Another customer-requested-this-week improvement so that when using view-as, there is additional email metadata for differentiating between different accounts or embed users.
Bit of quality of life work to pick from the list of user attributes rather than typing in the string exactly.
More quality of life work to quickly recover accidental unfavorites.
Quality of life work in the IDE as well - here better state management navigating the IDE, like folding, edit/redo state, etc. Just making life more pleasant for developers.

And some internal QOL and developer productivity work

Our developers get some quality of life work as well - here a tool for renewing AWS tokens.

Quick demo of some improvements to our internal tooling for Claude Code to workflow CI debugging.

Luke shows off a quick workflow we built to stay up on engineering work weekly using dashboard summary to quickly understand recently shipped code.
Our developers get some quality of life work as well - here a tool for renewing AWS tokens.
Quick demo of some improvements to our internal tooling for Claude Code to workflow CI debugging.
Luke shows off a quick workflow we built to stay up on engineering work weekly using dashboard summary to quickly understand recently shipped code.

weeks_detail.title: Demos
summary_bullets: Soon you'll be able to officially bring your own LLMs to Omni, starting with ChatGPT and Claude alongside our native Bedrock. More models to come.
Now you can see exactly what Blobby did on each query - clearly showing calcs, new fields, etc without drilling to the workbook page.
Now Blobby can build KPI visualizations alongside the cartesian plots and pie charts available today.
Now Blobby will build a list of model suggestions in AI sessions as you go, so the model can be refined with improvements built through end-user sessions.
More driving smart AI enablers into every action in the app. Now you can build custom scheduler timings using LLMs to build nuanced cron schedules.
Some internal facing work to quickly spin up Figma mocks using the core app (plus a little AI of course).
Blobby has a new skill - now you can ask about model concepts in the AI experience, asking about how fields are defined, what is in the model, etc.
Few new quick features for grabbing data quickly out of data tables (tables, columns, rows).
A few new pieces of work to clean up the tab renaming experience and theme swapping.
Some early work on tweaking the dashboard UX for filters - here limiting the date picker to just the calendar single-select.
Couple changes to make sure topic building with custom names works better and be able to debug dynamic connections in the inspector.
Added a new Excel function to enable text formatting with PROPER (ie. first-letter-capitalized)
Couple new quick-fields for boolean dimensions - Count Yes and Count No.
Bit more work getting cross-filtering enabled for dashboards. Some design work to do here still.
The last piece of work underpinning our new vis pipeline - now you can build mixed stacked charts, including all the familiar UX around labels, series selection, etc.
More work to make sure container styling aligns well with the current dashboard experience.
Now you can kick out a billion pivoted rows if you really wanted to.
Now you can customize you table delimiters for exporting (ie tabs, line breaks).
Max shows off a beautiful new styled dashboard for fantasy football analysis, using all the new bells and whistles.
Quick piece of work to allow resize on the cell viewer (UI for viewing a single cell as you navigate the table).
More quality of life work - here a quick link to the model for a given field from the table itself.
A new dashboard migrator tool from our services team. This is for moving dashboards across model (ie. regional connections or staging / prod workflows).

Bringing one of your most requested features - now the paintbrush everyone loves in Excel is available in Omni. Copy value formats, orientation, or conditional formatting quickly across lots of columns.

weeks_detail.title: Demos
summary_bullets: A first look at bringing Blobby to a native Slack app.
Now your field picker can nest as deeply as you like. For the organizers you can build custom group levels for navigating the field picker more easily.
We made filter suggestion better - prioritizing starts with, then spaces before search terms, and then any match.
A new UX to quickly navigate to any recent analyses or dashboards. Making it easier to find everything you've just been working on or looking at.

A first look at some new AI powered UX to extract modelable fields from your SQL. Can get out of your way when you don't need it, but also quickly provide a workflow to make sure you aren't ever doing the same work twice.
Blobby keeps getting smarter. Now you can authenticate yourself into Google Drive and search internal documents for relevant questions inside Blobby.
Bit of work to tune up the scheduler for linked tabs (recently released ability to duplicate-and-link tabs).
Now users can get alerted when dashboards are shared.
Work on new dashboard containers continues - bunch of work here around layout and organizing inside containers.
Some work here to make sure query killing is effective with filter suggestions, which can fire off several queries as the user types.
Now you can build a new branch from an existing branch to fork and test for more complex build outs.
New support for Oracle data

Now vis will properly account for order_by_fields, making sure months stay in order, tiers are respected, etc. Some improvements to make sure labels with stringified fields work properly - opening nice custom labeling patterns with IF() and TEXT()
Bit of work to make sure regressions label smoothly ;)
When loading vanity domains in Safari you can now skip the logo spinner screen entirely.
Subtle change to Safari embed to drop the Omni logo on cookie accept modal.
Bit of silent work to make folder navigation and finding the dashboard you need faster.
A quick add to bring the PDF and PNG export experience to workbooks from dashboards.
More behind the scenes perf work to improve query planning.
Bunch of work to improve performance and app stability, and a deep dive on the investigation.
We're adding a new guides section to docs for deep dives into full end-to-end workflows in Omni. Plus a quick look at how we write docs internally.
We continue to improve internal AI development workflows to make sure we can ship more product.
Bit of new internal tooling to make sure we can track the development process better.
And a discussion of some new internal improvements to CLI

weeks_detail.title: Demos
summary_bullets: Dashboard tabs and containers are getting close to GA. For the cutting edge folks, we're open to turning this on (there may be bumps). But enormous amount of new dashboard functionality coming soon. Here we demo filters above and below tabs, the tab building experience, and more. Ask us if you want to get in early (it is all or nothing though, so fair warning).

Now you can granularly control who has access to Blobby. This means everyone can start testing AI as conservatively as they want. Can't emphasize enough how transformative it has been for us internally. Go try it!

We're playing around with workflows to automate anything you can imagine in app with AI. Here we have Claude Code change the AI icon by navigating the core UI. Lots to do here, but would love to hear about use cases folks are imagining.

We extended AI link sharing to everyone in the system with permissions. User attributes, data permissions, etc are all respected here, but now for users with similar permissions AI links can be easily passed around (safely!!).
Blobby lives in Microsoft. Continuing the build out of Omni's multi-cloud offering, now AI is up and running.
We're tuning up the UX for deep research to give Blobby plenty of space to explore without burying the important outcomes.

Our huge rebuild of the vis render experience is close. We're waiting on a core Firefox bug we discovered building this, but the outcome is enormous (think 50k, 100k, 500k point visualizations) now render and resize smoothly.
We're getting close on our pie chart rebuild. Big wins with smart labeling and more features coming.
Getting close to the finale on merging stacked measures with color-by charts for config. Now simple totals are easy on stacked measure charts.

Level of detail fields are a huge unlock for comparing to overall populations or sub-populations and now you can also take advantage of filter escaping or inclusion dynamically (think compare a row to the top 10 without filters, etc).
We're continuing to make it easier to DIY debugging scheduler hiccups like query errors or delivery blockages.
Claude wanted to get in on the demos. Here's a bit of work to clean up clearing single-select filters.

weeks_detail.title: Demos
summary_bullets: Blobby has been studying hard. Now you can connect Omni to Google Drive and search files outside Omni directly from Blobby. This lays the groundwork for bringing AI context from completely outside the system into an analysis, or even just asking quick questions from inside the AI window. Excited to see how folks use this one.
Smart vis building from AI coming soon. A final demo of the query, interpret, visualize workflow for building better vis or hand tuning via AI.
Ever expanding Blobby's capability. Now you can chain together pairs of independent queries through lookups to bring time-series next to each other or other ad hoc use cases.

Another new skill for Blobby. Now you can requery previous queries through intermediate query views. Useful for regrouped aggregates, or other types of more complex analyses. Still some work to do on engaging when to use all these new techniques.'
Steven shows off a new project management tool he built to manage Claude Code and keep the robots on task.
An early look at some work to layer intelligent auto-completion (think cursor) into the model development experience.

This is a new idea to open up AI functions to our calculation language using the AI native functions in the data warehouse (think Snowflake Cortex or Databricks AI Functions or BigQuery AI functions). This opens up on-the-fly classification or summary, lots of great use cases, but bit more work to do to launch.
Demo of a new technique for developing AI context and getting better results from Blobby using Cursor.
The containers work isn't just about single-page layout, it's laying the ground work for native tabbed dashboards. Luke previews a first look at the editor experience for tabs.
Still chugging along on dashboard containers. Here's a first look at the new layout controls and experience for builders.
Now you can export individual spreadsheet tabs from the dashboard, we'll take care of the query dependencies.
Continuing the work on lifting Omni into Azure - a quick demo of downloads in the new stack.

We're testing Arrow for connectivity to the data warehouse (rather than JDBC). The result is massive speed-ups over large result sets, and even some small ones over tiny datasets. Still exploring, but hopeful this can make Omni even faster for everyone.
Before models get built, finding what you need was too hard. We're making that set-up process easier to get started with Omni.

weeks_detail.title: Demos
summary_bullets: We're teaching Blobby to model. Now you can build topics on the fly in AI, add relationships, or just generally do whatever you need from a modeling standpoint. Amazing for getting started or just supplementing the current model.

Blobby now knows *you* - great for lots of analyses (show me my pipeline, my customers, my usage, etc). This also means you can use mustache dynamically in AI context to pass user-specific information.

We're teaching Blobby more skills. Soon Blobby will be able to edit the fullness of the visualization spec - add labels, change axes, chart types, colors - anything you can do in the UI. Bit more to do here, but no more UI for building unless you want it.

We're playing around with new techniques to improve the AI experience. Here we use Snowflake Cortex to build a fuzzy search index for easier topical lookups. This would open up more natural filtering behaviors for lots of use cases (like support tickets in the demo).
Now you can create completely dynamic groups even based on associated metrics (ie. top 10 by count + other).
For many use cases you want complete review on dashboard changes. Now you can enforce branch-based changes through git for specific dashboards.
Our first demo of running queries in Azure. More work to do but Omni is going multi-cloud.
More Azure progress, this time on the renderer.
Continuing all the progress on dashboard containers, we go through an end-to-end example of a complex dashboard layout.
Tuning up the experience vis-a-vis workbook models and topic scoped models to give you all the control you need.
Spending a bit of time buffing out a rough edge around removing ignore in branches.
A demo of some new internal tooling to help solutions engineers understand how we talk about different topics in the field.

weeks_detail.title: Demos
summary_bullets: Now in a couple clicks you can view a dashboard as any user in the system. Fast debugging and embed configuration. Also our first demo from the Explo team!!

Continuing work on dashboard AI summarization. We overhauled the UX to enable selectively including queries and making sure we aren't running extra queries either. All in service of intelligent summaries across a bunch of different queries, even through the scheduler.
The docs are getting a huge overhaul in service of better search and a simpler navigation experience. We're still a few weeks out, but will include AI Q&A and a hugely improved search experience.
We tuned up the heuristics for handling abandoned queries to make sure we keep the database load as light as possible and optimize performance.

While most customers have a great experience with our live Slack chat, we are also opening up in-app chat for folks that prefer the web native experience. Want to make sure anyone who needs real time support gets it.
We tuned up in_query to improve query optimization on non-dependent tables. Should be mostly silent but just much faster for complex dynamic queries.
We tuned up the color palette building experience for customizing the full app - now with previews and a front-end for color picking. All about making the basics delightful.
We're continuing the work to extend configuration in the dashboard experience.
Now you can coordinate work in dbt branches alongside Omni branches seamlessly.
A quick internal demo of bring our employee data into Blobby's AI context. Incredible for quickly working with the context of the business over analytics (show me XYZ's team performance, etc).
We rolling out the customization of fine-grained application controls for end users. Will be continuing to build out depth of control here across the app.
Some early working on turning AI threads into quick dashboards for sharing the analysis in different ways.

weeks_detail.title: Demos
summary_bullets: Another preview of all the work on dashboard building with our new containers system (ie floating filters and sections).

Soon you'll be able to duplicate, but lock linkage to queries in your workbook. This allows separate visualizations of the same data, with firm linking to the source query for better reusability and management.
A first look at required filters for dashboards. Still a little UX polish here, but now you can build workflow into your dashboards better.
A bunch of work on building and managing extracts (plus take a look at the query speed underneath).
We made it easier to call queries for fast dynamic dashboard text building.
Now when scheduling to embed user emails, you can utilize send as recipient for dynamic scheduled content to your existing embed users.
Some new tools for managing authentication cookies in embed deployments with vanity domains.

Plus another pile of AI work

Now your uploaded files will be retained for the full session, or even multiple files (modulo context window), for deeper, more-complex analyses.

We're coming up with easier ways to build topics using AI.

We tidied up topic select in chat.
Now your uploaded files will be retained for the full session, or even multiple files (modulo context window), for deeper, more-complex analyses.
We're coming up with easier ways to build topics using AI.
We tidied up topic select in chat.

And a bunch more throughout the app

We tuned up when to use white or black text with conditional formatting and cell highlighting to make sure the values pop.

More new markdown vis for showing charts like uptime levels or progress to goal with highlighting.

A new experience that allows being conservative with database load (ie hit the run button), but still allows for instant results from the cache. Great for cache debugging as well.

We're nearing the end of our project to make large visualizations more scalable and faster. The last piece was our smart label work.

videos.description: Another preview of all the work on dashboard building with our new containers system (ie floating filters and sections).
videos.author: Luke Bowerman

videos.title: Workbook Query Linking
videos.description: Soon you'll be able to duplicate, but lock linkage to queries in your workbook. This allows separate visualizations of the same data, with firm linking to the source query for better reusability and management.
videos.author: Steven Talbot

videos.title: Dashboard Required Filters Preview
videos.description: A first look at required filters for dashboards. Still a little UX polish here, but now you can build workflow into your dashboards better.
videos.author: Steven Talbot

videos.title: More Extracts Progress
videos.description: A bunch of work on building and managing extracts (plus take a look at the query speed underneath).
videos.author: TJ Banghart

videos.title: Easier Query References on Dash Markdown
videos.description: We made it easier to call queries for fast dynamic dashboard text building.
videos.author: Meredith Dodge

videos.title: Embed User Dynamic Scheduling with User Attributes
videos.description: Now when scheduling to embed user emails, you can utilize send as recipient for dynamic scheduled content to your existing embed users.
videos.author: Nate Agrin

videos.title: New Embed Vanity Domain Cookie Controls
videos.description: Some new tools for managing authentication cookies in embed deployments with vanity domains.
videos.author: Nate Agrin

videos.title: AI File Upload v2
videos.description: Now your uploaded files will be retained for the full session, or even multiple files (modulo context window), for deeper, more-complex analyses.
videos.author: Gustav Staprans

videos.title: AI Topic Builder v1
videos.description: We're coming up with easier ways to build topics using AI.
videos.author: Gustav Staprans

videos.title: AI Topics Organization
videos.description: We tidied up topic select in chat.
videos.author: Gustav Staprans

videos.title: Better Conditional Formatting Text
videos.description: We tuned up when to use white or black text with conditional formatting and cell highlighting to make sure the values pop.
videos.author: Jared Hardy

videos.title: Uptime Vis and Progress Vis
videos.description: More new markdown vis for showing charts like uptime levels or progress to goal with highlighting.
videos.author: Sarah Waterson

videos.title: Cache Only Auto Run
videos.description: A new experience that allows being conservative with database load (ie hit the run button), but still allows for instant results from the cache. Great for cache debugging as well.
videos.author: Jonathan Swenson

videos.title: More Work on Scalable Vis Pipeline
videos.description: We're nearing the end of our project to make large visualizations more scalable and faster. The last piece was our smart label work.
videos.author: Nate Agrin

weeks_detail.title: Demos
summary_bullets:
As always a pile of new AI

A new skills system for Blobby. Now developers can build structured workflows (think input requirements, multi-step analysis) directly into Blobby. This means your most common workflows - lookups, cohort analysis, really anything can be tightly controlled and organized for end users. Excited to see what folks build here.

A sort of demo of the new Haiku 4.5 experience - smarter, faster, cheaper - coming soon.

A new skills system for Blobby. Now developers can build structured workflows (think input requirements, multi-step analysis) directly into Blobby. This means your most common workflows - lookups, cohort analysis, really anything can be tightly controlled and organized for end users. Excited to see what folks build here.
A sort of demo of the new Haiku 4.5 experience - smarter, faster, cheaper - coming soon.
We have a beautiful new dedicated UX for understanding your join structure in the data model.
We built a new experience to quickly understand the custom styling in light and dark mode to tighten up the experience quickly.
More groundwork for our new dashboard experience. Now you can duplicate filters on the same field and apply differentially. This means tile-level filters will be easy and flexible.
Always tuning up quality of life. Here we have a pair of UX improvements to get what you want quicker and more easily, including a beautiful new tab search experience for workbooks.
We tightened up the CLI experience for syncing with main, and now have folks using our package live. Take a look!
Pulling metadata from the Slack API is pretty slow, so we reworked our experience to make sure that's not a blocker to building schedules.
An internal facing demo of some improvements to our developer workflows.

And by popular demand some new Blobby tools

We built a web app so anyone can build their own Blobby. More for us than you, but have fun with it.

We've gotten lots of questions about our ridiculous breadth of Blobby emojis in Slack, so landed a repo of Blobbies all kinds for the enjoyers out there.
We built a web app so anyone can build their own Blobby. More for us than you, but have fun with it.
We've gotten lots of questions about our ridiculous breadth of Blobby emojis in Slack, so landed a repo of Blobbies all kinds for the enjoyers out there.

weeks_detail.title: Demos
summary_bullets: A first look at in-line documentation in the IDE. No more digging for docs as you build, now you have the full model reference code base at your fingertips.

We added a UI builder for Cubes (aggregate awareness to build intermediate caching), plus layered in clear debugging for the inspector. This is all in service of faster dashboards and exploration for everyone.

Blobby has a new skill - now you can bring files into your AI analyses - including CSVs, PDFs, and images. This means Blobby can be used for "vanilla" analyses, alongside Omni queries. Also includes some discussion of future extension points.
We massively increased the data available for summarization and analysis via AI. There are still limits for enormous data sets based on Claude token input limits, but now we're using all of it.
Continuing to iterate on deep research mode to make Blobby more disciplined around multi-query workflows and logical chains. Here we make sure each task is being completed and checked off.
We added some helper text for editors to understand the AI experience that will be available to dashboard AI users.
We're getting close to release our external IDE experience in NPM. Search for "Omni Client YAML Local Something Something" soon.
We're still working on bringing your dbt semantic models into Omni. We've extended model building to metrics in your dbt models, plus bit of discussion on future work.
Continuing to tune up the level-of-detail metrics building experience, including some new icons to make them clearer.
Now your spreadsheets will export in all their formatted glory for both downloads and scheduling. We'll also bring dependency data tabs to make sure everything is working nicely.
We polished up the experience with subtotaled tables and controls to allow for dynamic grouping hierarchy and layouts.
Bunch of polish to the table resizing experience, and bit of work on icons in the IDE as well
We'll be opening up IDP initiated SAML next week for customers, so enjoy one final demo.
We've improved our testing to allow for more, faster development for our team.

videos.title: Blobby Learns Multi Modal Inputs ie Files
videos.description: Blobby has a new skill - now you can bring files into your AI analyses - including CSVs, PDFs, and images. This means Blobby can be used for "vanilla" analyses, alongside Omni queries. Also includes some discussion of future extension points.

videos.title: AI Summarization Row Limit Massive Increase
videos.description: We massively increased the data available for summarization and analysis via AI. There are still limits for enormous data sets based on Claude token input limits, but now we're using all of it.
videos.author: Steven Talbot

videos.title: Blobby Gets Even Better at Checklists
videos.description: Continuing to iterate on deep research mode to make Blobby more disciplined around multi-query workflows and logical chains. Here we make sure each task is being completed and checked off.

videos.description: We added some helper text for editors to understand the AI experience that will be available to dashboard AI users.

videos.description: We're getting close to release our external IDE experience in NPM. Search for "Omni Client YAML Local Something Something" soon.

videos.description: We're still working on bringing your dbt semantic models into Omni. We've extended model building to metrics in your dbt models, plus bit of discussion on future work.

videos.description: Continuing to tune up the level-of-detail metrics building experience, including some new icons to make them clearer.

videos.title: Omni IDE Native in Claude Code
videos.description: We're working on bringing the develop experience anywhere you are. Here we show some model building in a branch using Claude Code. Soon you'll be able to develop in Omni in whatever development environment you prefer.
videos.author: Steven Talbot

videos.title: Blobby Learns Planning Checklists
videos.description: Now when Blobby builds query plans, you'll see a full breakdown of queries and Blobby will check-off tasks as they are completely. The goal is just better control and insight into the querying process for AI.
videos.author: Gustav Staprans

videos.title: Blobby Session Sharing Improvements
videos.description: Now you can quickly re-run queries from AI sessions you share or return too. We also polished up the sidebar experience for finding any of your previous chats.
videos.author: Steven Talbot

videos.title: Blobby Writes a 500 Join Query
videos.description: We hope you never do this, but sometimes it's fun to test the bounds of the app and Blobby. Here Blobby writes a 500 join query without sweating.
videos.author: Colin Zima

videos.title: New Dash Almost Launch
videos.description: We're nearing the launch of flexible dashboard filters, the first of many pieces of work to more completely customize the full dashboard experience.
videos.author: Luke Bowerman

videos.title: Localization First Look
videos.description: First look at a fully localized Omni dashboard. More to do, but great progress.
videos.author: Arielle Strong

videos.title: SQL Preamble
videos.description: You can now run arbitrary command in the database prior to queries. This opens up all sorts of custom workflows including UDFs or custom user variables.
videos.author: Steven Talbot

videos.title: Fast, Performant Giant Vis
videos.description: We're getting close to rolling out an overhaul to our rendering experience for vis that massively improves performance on the largest queries.
videos.author: Rob Miller

videos.title: Map Region Backgrounds
videos.description: We add custom background so your shapefiles can be more clear in empty zones if you'd prefer.
videos.author: Rob Miller

videos.title: Range Bound Charts
videos.description: Another new custom vis, this one for representing metrics inside a target band.
videos.author: Sarah Waterson

videos.title: Bullet Charts
videos.description: We're adding new code for a pair of bullet visualization implementations - one in Vega that we demo here and another beautiful example with markdown.
videos.author: Colin Zima

videos.title: Custom Trendline Colors
videos.description: Nearing the completion of our major vis refactor, but added a bit more functionality to customize trend lines.
videos.author: Nate Agrin

videos.title: Query Performance Analytics
videos.description: We added a new dashboard to analytics with a full breakdown of query performance for much better understanding of end user experience and where to focus developer effort.
videos.author: Jade Khiev

videos.title: Sharing Ephemeral Spreadsheets Via URL
videos.description: Now when end users take advantage of dynamic spreadsheets on dashboards, they can be shared in their edited state.
videos.author: Arielle Strong

videos.title: Drill Embed Event
videos.description: We added a custom event for developers to capture drill events and build any customization desired.
videos.author: Nate Agrin

videos.title: More App CSS Theming
videos.description: Continuing the build out of custom theming across the entire app. Here we demo some custom sidebars.
videos.author: Elliot Park

videos.title: Custom Unnested JSON Field Naming and Better Schema Refresh
videos.description: Pair of demos. First, some work to give more control over names for fields from nested JSON. Second, bit of tune up to the schema refresh to make it simpler.
videos.author: Conrad Slimmer

videos.title: Grab Gab of New Docs
videos.description: We landed a bunch of new docs this week on everything from mustache to email user attributes to APIs to SCIM.
videos.author: Erin Cochran

videos.title: dbt Semantic Layer
videos.description: Our first demo of building the Omni data model with your dbt semantic layer. Lots more work to do here bringing different field types into Omni, but much progress on syncing models between systems.
videos.author: Buck Ryan

videos.title: AI Session History
videos.description: We're launching sticky, shareable sessions for AI - allowing users to return to previous analyses or share the outputs with coworkers.
videos.author: Steven Talbot

videos.title: Vega Re-aggregation Alpha
videos.description: We're continuing to experiment with ways to make giant data sets visualize quickly and intuitively. Still more to figure out here, but progress on these new workflows.
videos.author: Nate Agrin

videos.title: Model Blame History
videos.description: Rather than hunting through your git provider, we're bringing blame to the model to understand the most recent changes to fields, views, topics, and relationships.
videos.author: Cathy Lennon

videos.title: Dashboard Filters Anywhere
videos.description: We're getting close to some huge new functionality on dashboards. Here we demo new dashboard containers, allowing sticky filters, moving filters alongside tiles or groups of tiles, and new layout experiences. Coming soon (end of Sept)!
videos.author: Luke Bowerman

videos.title: Massive Vis, Big Performance Wins
videos.description: We're continuing to toil away on the most complex, largest visualizations. Here, some work to optimize tooltips in edit mode (ie hide them), and new work to pause rendering for dashboard arrangement - the combo massively speeds up the browser for visualizations with thousands or tens of thousands of data points.
videos.author: Nate Agrin

videos.title: Easy Column Renaming
videos.description: A little tune up to make editing column headers easier via right click.
videos.author: Sarah Waterson

videos.title: Full App CSS Control
videos.description: The first demo of fulling customizing styles in Omni (think content system, even admin pages).

videos.title: Fine Grain Auth Controls
videos.description: A bit of new functionality to fine tune the login experience, including hiding Google Auth and magic links for the SAML folks.
videos.author: Luke Bowerman

videos.title: Per User API Tokens
videos.description: Now the API can be scoped and provisioned on a per-user basis for locking permissions to a given user rather than setting up global auth.
videos.author: Corey Ruderman

videos.title: Git Settings Overhaul
videos.description: We massively overhauled the git setting page to make configuration and management simpler and more understandable.
videos.author: Jared Hardy

videos.title: Bulk Branch Management
videos.description: Now developers can manage all of their Omni branches in one place, including fast cleanup of unused branches and lots of metadata to more easily understand what is outstanding.
videos.author: Meredith Dodge

videos.title: MCP OAuth
videos.description: User permissions can now be passed to the MCP server, allowing fine grain permissions on a per-user basis for DIY use cases outside Omni.
videos.author: Gustav Staprans

videos.title: Mapping GeoJSON Data Directly From Fields
videos.description: A new option for bringing map data into Omni. We're now able to read from GeoJSON in the result set to dynamically map row by row.
videos.author: Rob Miller

videos.title: Embed Scroll Jumping Fix
videos.description: We improved the navigation experience for embedded iframes to smooth out the end user experience during resorting and drilling.
videos.author: Nate Agrin

summary_bullets:
A pair of huge new spreadsheet features:

Spreadsheets in Omni just got a new super power. Now you can unlock specific cells at the dashboard level for completely dynamic spreadsheet workflows - simulation, editing, override. We do a quick simulation demo for growth rates and financial assumptions, but huge possibilities now for all your dashboard users.

More super powers for your spreadsheets. Now cells with pre-existing Omni drills can bring that depth into the spreadsheet UI.

Spreadsheets in Omni just got a new super power. Now you can unlock specific cells at the dashboard level for completely dynamic spreadsheet workflows - simulation, editing, override. We do a quick simulation demo for growth rates and financial assumptions, but huge possibilities now for all your dashboard users.
More super powers for your spreadsheets. Now cells with pre-existing Omni drills can bring that depth into the spreadsheet UI.
A final demo of the native Google Sheets export functionality, including all the care we took to make sure you have all the controls you need for a diversity of use cases (append, replace, etc)

And Blobby has been learning more new skills

An end-to-end demo of using AI to go deeper from the context of the dashboard.

Sometimes users don't know the exact format of a filter value - it is USA, US, or United States. Now it doesn't matter. Agent Blobby will check for valid filter inputs to make sure users find what they need.

Soon Blobby will be able to query or navigate to pre-existing content in Omni like dashboards.

weeks_detail.title: Demos
summary_bullets: This week Blobby got unleashed. Continuing on the build out of Agent Blobby, we have a demo of AI doing a little bit of everything - building a plan, multi-query execution, some data modeling, and even building a dashboard. This is all locked up behind the agent launch (TBD), but huge progress in the scope of automated analysis.
We built a quick accelerator to bucket results into Top N + Other. This will also work across pivots or multiple series because it's backed by a mini data model. No more 200 slice pie charts.
Now you can sync all the work in your Snowflake Semantic Layer into Omni seamlessly.

More infusing AI into everything in the app

Adding dashboard summary text above the visualization powered by the visualization results themselves. Also opens up longer form hover-over descriptions of the tiles as well.

We added more AI to our KPI vis as well with an intelligent summary snippet to pair alongside metrics, changes, sparklines, etc.
Adding dashboard summary text above the visualization powered by the visualization results themselves. Also opens up longer form hover-over descriptions of the tiles as well.
We added more AI to our KPI vis as well with an intelligent summary snippet to pair alongside metrics, changes, sparklines, etc.

Huge progress unifying multi-measure and color faceted charts with stacking, labeling, and faceting. The new visualization pipeline will both improve the quality for existing vis, but also open up lots of really nice improvements around the edges of mixing all of these complex chart types together.

Luke gives another demo on the continuing progress around dashboard containers, tabs, and more filters around. Raw UI, but get to see the bones of all the future flexibility coming to the dashboard layer.
We dolled up the markdown gallery for faster, better, easier discovery of all the unique advanced visualizations you can build in Omni.
We made everything surrounding the dbt workflow faster, plus a few metrics to prove it.

Want to make sure the app always feels fresh, so we're polishing up the log-in page and the homepage landing experience. This all builds out the groundwork for more extensive full-app styling controls for folks that want to hijack our CSS and make it feel like theirs.
We made our join inference a little smarter by reading the DB metadata to build a more comprehensive join library.

summary_bullets: We're bring more Omni metadata back to dbt with exposures. Soon you will be able to understand all of the downstream impacts of your dbt changing in Omni.
Justin shows off a brand new embedded demo full of NFL stats. A taste of what is achievable embedding Omni and curating the user experience.
A guest demo from our friends at Wayflyer of a micro-site built to learn Omni using a mix of docs and our Youtube demos!
Continuing our work on AI dashboard summaries to pull out important insights and potential follow up areas. Plus a little UI work to make it more readible.
Close to the launch of user-scoped API keys. Now all of the external API use cases can be scoped to a specific account for more tactical API needs.
Another beautiful new Markdown chart showing progress in a metric with nice gradients for clarity (let us know if there is a real name for this chart type).
You'll soon be able to toggle between temporal, nominal, and ordinal data types on charts for more granular handling of data sets when it needs to be just right.
Now you can schedule to Omni user groups alongside email addresses.
We added support for finding specific pieces of content (dashboards or workbooks) in the content validator. Best for tactical change management.
We're launched model permissions beneath connection permissions, and also layered in a new modeler/developer user distinct from the connection admin.
We're making model extensions smarter. Now you can call user attributes with mustache to create more complex model layers for the most complex data modeling challenges.
An end to end demo of both querying and building Snowflake Semantic Views via Omni.
More, better auth with OpenID Connect

weeks_detail.title: Demos
summary_bullets: Your most requested feature is near. We're building native connection to Google Sheets, including per user auth and fine grain controls for overwrite vs addition. Week or two out!
Our second most requested feature is close. We're now allowing the exclusion or isolation of series via legend clicks - drill in place directly from the visualization.
Slowly getting closer to nesting filters in dashboard sections (think tabs and tiles). Plus getting closer on native dashboard tabs.
Another hugely requested feature to pass Omni metadata into the database logs for simpler usage debugging and cost attribution. All available via our logs, but now in the DB query logs as well.
Peter demos our mini app for building Snowflake Semantic Views from your Omni data model. Want to make sure you can bring your business logic wherever it needs to go.

The cache now has a max age of 30 days. Normally this may not make sense, but if you watch this video you'll see the instant-query experience after enabling extracts over a SQL query. Think write one [often slow] query, cache, and requery pseudo-instantly.
More work on opening up native dashboard tabs. We're streamlining the dashboard build to get it ready for multiple-tabs.
We added mustache controls to the email body, allowing dynamic text based on query results for the most polished emails.
Now fresh results are a click away in the drill modal.
We're still beefing up level of detail calculations for window function analyses using dimensionalization alongside LoD (think compare to min/max/average among other use cases).
Another new markdown visualization for building beautiful cohort tables (think retention rates + cohort sizes).
Nate continues to toil deep in the Vega mines to bring multi-measure charts to parity with color faceted charts.
Soon series will configure independently more easily with all the functionality you expect.
We made sure period-over-periods in KPIs function a bit better with comparison period swapping.
This should be mostly silent for end users, but begins the underpinnings that all for IDP initiated log-in for folks using SAML.
We walk through some new internal tooling to handle cross-browser integration testing.
We walk through some new docs for developer training.

weeks_detail.title: Demos
summary_bullets: Agent Blobby is coming. We're taking the training wheels off AI and allowing multi-query sessions when appropriate. This opens up chain of thought and requery analysis. Plenty more to do here, but more open experiences are coming.

Blobby is coming to the dashboard. We're working on passing dashboard context to the AI experience for more tactical use cases, or just to do analysis in line with the dashboard. Some commentary on future improvements as well.
Excited to share a guest demo from Jamie Fry at Hawkfry. We take a look at a complete embedded AI-for-data experience - including some classic BI and lots of AI interpretation and query.

The UI builder for topics has significantly more surface area now - field controls, modeling, and curation all from the front-end. IDE still there when you need it, but making sure we lift the entire experience to the UI as well.

A big grab bag of vis improvements:

Work on multi-measure charts in the new vis framework to extend the controls

Independent axis stack controls

Improved markdown vis references for dates

Better empty tooltip hover experience

We're starting our work on making dashboards orders of magnitude more flexible. Here's a first look at some layout controls and the code behind it. More down the path of applicationizing the dashboard experience.

Bunch of improvements to the trellis experiences in GA.

Little tune up to the map experience adding color picker and some sizing controls.
Work on multi-measure charts in the new vis framework to extend the controls
Independent axis stack controls
Improved markdown vis references for dates
Better empty tooltip hover experience

We're starting our work on making dashboards orders of magnitude more flexible. Here's a first look at some layout controls and the code behind it. More down the path of applicationizing the dashboard experience.
Bunch of improvements to the trellis experiences in GA.
Little tune up to the map experience adding color picker and some sizing controls.
